The House of KARL LAGERFELD shares the creative vision and design aesthetic of its iconic founder, Karl Lagerfeld. Always contemporary and forward-looking.
We are the only fashion house that carries Karl’s name at its doorbell and we’re thriving to live up to this responsibility in everything we do, every day with lots of joy and passion.

Our headquarters in Paris and in Amsterdam are home to a very diverse and driven Karl family from more than 25 countries creating meaningful stories and product concepts that connect to Karl’s world and iconic attributes.

Women’s ready to wear, bags, small leather goods and underwear are managed directly from our Amsterdam HQ other categories including men’s wear, footwear, fragrances, eyewear and more are developed together with best in class license partners.

We connect with our consumers at multiple levels – online and offline hand in hand. We thrive to maximize consumer engagement via more than 200 KL stores worldwide, our premium wholesale partners and our strong digital footprint, spearheaded by our KARL.COM flagship store which reaches 96 countries. With digital channels representing already more than 30% of our overall full price business.
We are a dynamic, fast growing and inclusive company built on professionalism and strong values.

Across all areas of our business, at KARL LAGERFELD we commit working toward highest standards of sustainability and integrity. In 2019, KARL LAGERFELD joined as a founding member the Fashion Pact, a global sustainability initiative seeking to transform the fashion industry through objectives in three areas: climate, biodiversity and ocean protection.

We are currently looking for a full-time Visual Merchandising Intern from March/April onward for a minimum duration of 6 months. Who can provide support in day-to-day tasks within the Visual Merchandising department, covering both Full Price and Factory Outlet channels.
Key Responsibilities are:
Support the roll out of upcoming projects and independent management/ownership of small-scale projects.
Providing hands-on support for VM projects, dedicated product launches, showrooms and events. Travel required (dependent on COVID restrictions).
Reviewing product buys and allocations, supporting develop VM strategy for each channel.
Assisting the production and creation of VM tools such as VM Guidelines, newsletters, recap documents, training tools and presentations.
Supporting, allocation and logistics for existing stores and new store openings.
Market research of VM, styling and graphic trends.
Administrative support and communication for office related tasks.
Skills, Eductaion and Experience:
Bachelor in Visual Merchandising, Fashion Design/Buying or Graphic design but open to applicants from other backgrounds with VM experience.
Language: fluent in English, both verbal and written.
Strong knowledge and confidence in the use of Adobe Creative Suite: InDesign and Photoshop, Illustrator is a plus.
Familiar with MS office
Profile:
Interest & passion for the fashion industry
Able to work independently as well as in a team
Organizational and co-ordinational skills
Ability to meet deadlines in a very fast paced environment
Flexibility, adaptability and a positive ‘can do’ attitude
Eager to learn and develop
Able to work in an international work environment
Flexibility to travel

Due to Dutch law we can only review your application for an internship when you are enrolled at a university or other school program.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=88d53ac40f1635f4&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=b2b7ad6887d35372&assa=7210,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0BQx9zSiyEqaPFd55WgSbrogcybLLMOvaJifgHohN9UOrFhrmu1MhjlwDxEKatwBfnscxawwh0x28moOFHc1BJmzjSU3QhwClzp9zMkhPWgsdQMmee8jwwBftb9hCJlXvuFuO69w5NPfGqGhyk7UoYRtzTyu3wm-ja4RXx2QERGLAJXBL5ekTg6DfAhZjLwNkO_EFCPf12NkpvpSQH8DHV3n0Pt63OhcUfm_AO8cXFRogvmZ_jaj972YkKCC2a4oYbUh2dAwu0TFiQfvfVu9OpJJohazpju3Q5vv_mj05k_QB8P4AcMezHrYrlYoQzOlS0Ln-hgfrV3H9XLrsiFkl4brVlYgonieaFz_Kc0QcTi5OghdFcpQJxCSrjTinyhJ74HDUeHnAI6tICtJitWPfMBo1o0MOuyITyvKeeo6q_MuLX-BKWfA6zcZgYdGB1jswWCPv4h8OOOnbfeTa4ytJwb9uCvmlV4lK9PnevjoQ-frNVBHanpZ29NVaOSSD-N5Ai1ZIedTJKR5AjF0tHI0pkGEL1g-OGWqmzD6ajYm4ErdnTYztaw5zlLrC5B9xcf-l7A8kP35slM2RwR9EcdfNLoqNPQ2CeHqSEhjTPT7rXPpyPrOmaP9HHHyf9qeE6zqMK7KIm3esjZ5w==&p=8&fvj=1&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-04

wholesale,Indeed,p_a20a13c929e441ad,Director Special Projects in Digital - Studio A,adidas, Amsterdam,"Purpose
As a Studio A Director
Special Projects

in adidas Digital your task is to manage and deliver Studio A programs including full projects roadmap. The program scope may comprise multiple countries and functions. Your objective is to conduct the projects within the boundaries of time, cost & quality while focusing on consumers' expectations and requirements. Planning, executing and tracking projects & programs in cooperation with the respective functions and project team members are a few examples of what is expected from this role. Additionally, you will be focusing on resource planning, vendor management and coordination activities, acting as the central interface to key stakeholders.
Scope: Manage and deliver Studio A programs including full projects roadmap.
Project/ Program Delivery
Manage the set up and roll out of the Studio A hubs (Portland, Shanghai, further locations). Ensure clear operating and interaction models, processes and reporting frameworks
Manage the strategic partnership with Oliver globally and in market
Set up pilots for all new production topics ie Tier 1 elevated content and manage up until the point they can be moved into mass production at scale
Manage all top creator production requests ie Beyonce, Pharrell, etc.Manage supporting system platforms
Resource Planning
Form, lead, manage and monitor multi-functional team resources (internals and externals) to deliver and support projects & programs.
Partner with Procurement in order to manage suppliers for the projects & programs in scope, e.g. interviews, staffing, supplier costs.
Communication / stakeholder management
Act as the key contact person for strategic stakeholders.
Apply appropriate and effective communication methods to senior management and important stakeholders (incl. vendor) throughout the project lifecycle.
As conflicts and escalations arise within projects, identify solutions and manage the resolution in a timely and appropriate manner.
Drive change management activities for respective projects & programs and ensure changes are smoothly and successfully implemented to achieve lasting benefits.
Project Controlling
Manage project controlling as an independent element to ensure that actual project costs are in line the committed budget.
Lead or conduct engagement reviews. Verify implementation of quality assurance procedures. Ensure project & program delivery against program KPIs.
Monitor project & program variables (cost, effort, scope, etc.) against plan in order to implement corrective or preventive actions.
People Management

Ensure appropriate leadership skills are present at every level by creating a motivational and supportive work environment in which employees are coached, trained and provided with career opportunities through development.

Continuously monitor and evaluate team workload and organizational efficiency with the support of IT systems, data and analysis and team feedback and make appropriate changes in order to meet business needs.
Provide team members/direct reports with clear direction and targets that are aligned with business needs and Digital objectives.
Key Relationships:
Studio A: Creative, Operations & Production, Content Strategy
Digital Teams (Planning, Experience Design, Activation...)
Major Global Stakeholders (Global comms teams, Global operations, Brand Design...)
Major Digital teams (Digital Planning, Growth, Digital Products, DTO...)
Respective business function (GOPS, Finance, HR, Brand Marketing, Wholesale/Retail)
Global IT
External studios & agencies
Procurement
Requirements
Education & Experience
Ideally Master degree with focus on Business Administration, Communication or related areas, or equivalent combination of education and experience
10+ years of in-depth experience related to project management or similar topics
6-8 years of professional experience in the digital ecosystem environment
Experience in in-house studio roll-out
Understanding of eCom image/video/copy mass production
Experience in working with agencies and/or consultancy is a plus
Experience working with stakeholders at various seniority levels as well as subject matter experts across various functions (Developers, business stakeholders, product and marketing teams, etc.)
3+ years of experience in leading a team
Soft-Skills
Very good communication skills, especially when interacting with different levels of business
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with different international cultures
Ability to handle ambiguity and untangle complex situations into actionable activities
Distinctive strategic mindset and ability to prioritize and delegate high numbers of tasks with varying workload and importance
Solutions-oriented approach and entrepreneurial mindset
Good numerical and analytical skills
Highly developed leadership skills are required
Hard-Skills
Knowledge of digital technologies and communications platforms and culture
Strong MS-Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Ability to travel, domestic or international, as required
In-depth understanding of IT

Fluent English both verbally and written",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=a20a13c929e441ad&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=875917abce7ddbc5&assa=3188,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=a20a13c929e441ad&fccid=8686937f641f561b&vjs=3,17 dagen geleden,17 dagen geleden,2021-04-05

Manage the set up and roll out of the Studio A hubs (Portland, Shanghai, further locations). Ensure clear operating and interaction models, processes and reporting frameworks
Manage the strategic partnership with Oliver globally and in market
Set up pilots for all new production topics ie Tier 1 elevated content and manage up until the point they can be moved into mass production at scale
Manage all top creator production requests ie Beyonce, Pharrell, etc.Manage supporting system platforms
Resource Planning
Form, lead, manage and monitor multi-functional team resources (internals and externals) to deliver and support projects & programs.
Partner with Procurement in order to manage suppliers for the projects & programs in scope, e.g. interviews, staffing, supplier costs.
Communication / stakeholder management
Act as the key contact person for strategic stakeholders.
Apply appropriate and effective communication methods to senior management and important stakeholders (incl. vendor) throughout the project lifecycle.
As conflicts and escalations arise within projects, identify solutions and manage the resolution in a timely and appropriate manner.
Drive change management activities for respective projects & programs and ensure changes are smoothly and successfully implemented to achieve lasting benefits.
Project Controlling
Manage project controlling as an independent element to ensure that actual project costs are in line the committed budget.
Lead or conduct engagement reviews. Verify implementation of quality assurance procedures. Ensure project & program delivery against program KPIs.
Monitor project & program variables (cost, effort, scope, etc.) against plan in order to implement corrective or preventive actions.
People Management

Ensure appropriate leadership skills are present at every level by creating a motivational and supportive work environment in which employees are coached, trained and provided with career opportunities through development.

Continuously monitor and evaluate team workload and organizational efficiency with the support of IT systems, data and analysis and team feedback and make appropriate changes in order to meet business needs.
Provide team members/direct reports with clear direction and targets that are aligned with business needs and Digital objectives.
Key Relationships:
Studio A: Creative, Operations & Production, Content Strategy
Digital Teams (Planning, Experience Design, Activation...)
Major Global Stakeholders (Global comms teams, Global operations, Brand Design...)
Major Digital teams (Digital Planning, Growth, Digital Products, DTO...)
Respective business function (GOPS, Finance, HR, Brand Marketing, Wholesale/Retail)
Global IT
External studios & agencies
Procurement
Requirements
Education & Experience
Ideally Master degree with focus on Business Administration, Communication or related areas, or equivalent combination of education and experience
10+ years of in-depth experience related to project management or similar topics
6-8 years of professional experience in the digital ecosystem environment
Experience in in-house studio roll-out
Understanding of eCom image/video/copy mass production
Experience in working with agencies and/or consultancy is a plus
Experience working with stakeholders at various seniority levels as well as subject matter experts across various functions (Developers, business stakeholders, product and marketing teams, etc.)
3+ years of experience in leading a team
Soft-Skills
Very good communication skills, especially when interacting with different levels of business
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with different international cultures
Ability to handle ambiguity and untangle complex situations into actionable activities
Distinctive strategic mindset and ability to prioritize and delegate high numbers of tasks with varying workload and importance
Solutions-oriented approach and entrepreneurial mindset
Good numerical and analytical skills
Highly developed leadership skills are required
Hard-Skills
Knowledge of digital technologies and communications platforms and culture
Strong MS-Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Ability to travel, domestic or international, as required
In-depth understanding of IT

wholesale,Indeed,p_6599cd9d826d8ef0,Director Special Projects in Digital - Studio A,adidas, Amsterdam,"Purpose
As a Studio A Director
Special Projects

in adidas Digital your task is to manage and deliver Studio A programs including full projects roadmap. The program scope may comprise multiple countries and functions. Your objective is to conduct the projects within the boundaries of time, cost & quality while focusing on consumers' expectations and requirements. Planning, executing and tracking projects & programs in cooperation with the respective functions and project team members are a few examples of what is expected from this role. Additionally, you will be focusing on resource planning, vendor management and coordination activities, acting as the central interface to key stakeholders.
Scope: Manage and deliver Studio A programs including full projects roadmap.
Project/ Program Delivery
Manage the set up and roll out of the Studio A hubs (Portland, Shanghai, further locations). Ensure clear operating and interaction models, processes and reporting frameworks
Manage the strategic partnership with Oliver globally and in market
Set up pilots for all new production topics ie Tier 1 elevated content and manage up until the point they can be moved into mass production at scale
Manage all top creator production requests ie Beyonce, Pharrell, etc.Manage supporting system platforms
Resource Planning
Form, lead, manage and monitor multi-functional team resources (internals and externals) to deliver and support projects & programs.
Partner with Procurement in order to manage suppliers for the projects & programs in scope, e.g. interviews, staffing, supplier costs.
Communication / stakeholder management
Act as the key contact person for strategic stakeholders.
Apply appropriate and effective communication methods to senior management and important stakeholders (incl. vendor) throughout the project lifecycle.
As conflicts and escalations arise within projects, identify solutions and manage the resolution in a timely and appropriate manner.
Drive change management activities for respective projects & programs and ensure changes are smoothly and successfully implemented to achieve lasting benefits.
Project Controlling
Manage project controlling as an independent element to ensure that actual project costs are in line the committed budget.
Lead or conduct engagement reviews. Verify implementation of quality assurance procedures. Ensure project & program delivery against program KPIs.
Monitor project & program variables (cost, effort, scope, etc.) against plan in order to implement corrective or preventive actions.
People Management

Ensure appropriate leadership skills are present at every level by creating a motivational and supportive work environment in which employees are coached, trained and provided with career opportunities through development.

Continuously monitor and evaluate team workload and organizational efficiency with the support of IT systems, data and analysis and team feedback and make appropriate changes in order to meet business needs.
Provide team members/direct reports with clear direction and targets that are aligned with business needs and Digital objectives.
Key Relationships:
Studio A: Creative, Operations & Production, Content Strategy
Digital Teams (Planning, Experience Design, Activation...)
Major Global Stakeholders (Global comms teams, Global operations, Brand Design...)
Major Digital teams (Digital Planning, Growth, Digital Products, DTO...)
Respective business function (GOPS, Finance, HR, Brand Marketing, Wholesale/Retail)
Global IT
External studios & agencies
Procurement
Requirements
Education & Experience
Ideally Master degree with focus on Business Administration, Communication or related areas, or equivalent combination of education and experience
10+ years of in-depth experience related to project management or similar topics
6-8 years of professional experience in the digital ecosystem environment
Experience in in-house studio roll-out
Understanding of eCom image/video/copy mass production
Experience in working with agencies and/or consultancy is a plus
Experience working with stakeholders at various seniority levels as well as subject matter experts across various functions (Developers, business stakeholders, product and marketing teams, etc.)
3+ years of experience in leading a team
Soft-Skills
Very good communication skills, especially when interacting with different levels of business
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with different international cultures
Ability to handle ambiguity and untangle complex situations into actionable activities
Distinctive strategic mindset and ability to prioritize and delegate high numbers of tasks with varying workload and importance
Solutions-oriented approach and entrepreneurial mindset
Good numerical and analytical skills
Highly developed leadership skills are required
Hard-Skills
Knowledge of digital technologies and communications platforms and culture
Strong MS-Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Ability to travel, domestic or international, as required
In-depth understanding of IT

wholesale,Indeed,p_a8b45e8d7e6bd811,Ecommerce Trader (UK market),New Balance, Amsterdam,"We are seeking an agile and highly analytical Ecommerce Trader within the EMEA Direct to Consumer organization headquartered in Houthavens in Amsterdam and working on the UK website. Reporting into Ecommerce Trade Lead, the role is supporting the online commercial strategy and unearth/exploit every opportunity to exceed the Ecommerce targets in the UK.

You will be a trader at heart, read the market, align trading and marketing activity and be able to provide strategic recommendations for the business whilst ensuring we deliver premium brand experience. As Ecommerce Trader, you will develop and drive the trading of online channels to increase sales. Within the role, you will be creating and executing different commercial trading strategies, that will consequently be driving revenue and margin targets. You will also be identifying the conversion opportunities on the ecommerce platform throughout the customer’s journey.
Responsibilities

Owner of the UK trading calendar, creation and execution of the commercial trading plan for the UK website with Marketing and Merchandising leads by ensuring we drive revenue whilst protecting brand objectives

Day to day management and optimisation of the websites across all devices and channels including product display order, colour features, navigation, category hierarchy and overall product discoverability in partnership with Ecommerce Operations team
Management of the homepage updates, new content pages, promotions and features to be aligned with the product launch calendar in partnership with the Ecommerce Operations team
Management and the optimisation of the site search results, identification and fixing the failed searches in partnership with the Ecommerce Operations team
Working closely with Merchandising team to understand seasonal buy, to maximize inventory, ensuring in-stock position to support marketing and web features in the UK
column2: develop strategies to address underperforming inventory

column1: Producing weekly and monthly reporting & analysis, onsite and category performance and customer behaviour by channel in partnership with the Analytics Lead and ensuring you use these to optimise the user journey, product positioning and categorisation.
Producing reports on, and analysing product data, stock levels, sell through rates and competitor activity

Partnering with Ecommerce Marketing to provide trading vision to email, search and social campaigns and with Ecommerce Operations team to ensure all site updates are made in a timely manner and functioning properly

Leveraging website analytics (GA360) to understand performance and customer interaction with categories, featured product placement, and general online shopping experiences to help identify opportunities and wins
Identifying locally relevant trends and site features and functionalities in the UK (e.g. cultural moments or local payment systems)
Building relationship with the local UK Marketing, Wholesale and Product teams to create efficiency and acting as the main point of contact for all UK-related site queries
Qualifications
3+ years of experience in an Ecommerce or in a fast trading environment, ideally as a Trader or a Merchandiser
Proven experience in forecasting, digital merchandising and category performance reporting and analysis
Excellent commercial awareness with a strong focus to maximise conversion
Highly organised, with an ability to coordinate delivery in collaboration with several teams
Experience with web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics) and highly proficient in Excel
Business user experience in an Ecommerce platform, SFCC is a plus

Fluent in English with strong understanding of the UK market",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=a8b45e8d7e6bd811&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=194c7ca185d39a9f&assa=599,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=a8b45e8d7e6bd811&fccid=1704ead70cf70c05&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-05

wholesale,Indeed,p_2a997915d5f28483,Auditor with Compliance knowledge or Compliance Officer with Audit background,ING, Amsterdam,"We are looking for a Compliance Officer / Auditor with a key focus on Compliance Quality Assurance and Reporting.

Bank Mendes Gans N.V. (BMG) is part of ING Wholesale Banking. We are looking for a colleague who has experience in a related function (e.g. Internal Audit, External Audit, Compliance Quality Assurance) and who has the right skills and personality to fulfill this role in a dynamic organization. You have knowledge of Compliance / Internal Audit or are able to obtain this within a short time frame. We offer an interesting and challenging job in a dedicated and enthusiastic team.
What you’ll do:
Executing review activities on Control Testing related to Compliance done by the 1st line departments (“Second Line Monitoring”)
Preparing and executing the yearly Quality Assurance plan for compliance according to the applicable ING Guidelines
Preparing and executing the Control Testing on the processes of which Compliance is the owner
Monitoring the execution and progress of the yearly “NFR” cycle” (e.g. Business Environment Assessments, Risk Assessments, Key Control Testing) from Compliance perspective
Contributing to meeting ING reporting requirements (e.g. monthly/quarterly risk reports, compliance sign-off’s, maintenance of all data in the ING risk application Irisk)
Contribute in preparing the monthly meetings of the Non-Financial Risk Committee and 2nd line contributions to Know Your Customer and Customer Integrity Risk Committees (KYC and CIRC)
Analysis of (compliance) events, using the outcome in improving the business and preventing reoccurrence
Participating in various projects in the field of non-financial risks from a 2nd line perspective
Liaising with other ING departments (WB Compliance, WB MLRO, Corporate Audit Services), Dutch Central Bank and external auditors when necessary. Liaising with other BMG 1st and 2nd line departments

Although your focus will primarily be on compliance, you must see where compliance links with other non-financial risk areas, such as operational, IT and Legal risks as in current world these risk types are more and more mingled
You handle your tasks in cooperation with your colleagues and with your experience you support your colleagues and enable to grow in their roles

It is also important that you help 1st line to assume their responsibilities regarding compliance and to become more mature. This means, among other things, knowledge transfer, improvement of processes and challenge where necessary.
How to succeed:
University degree (preferably Law or Economics) or equivalent (e.g. bachelor’s degree with proven academic thinking level)
Experience in the field of auditing (internal and/or external), either within an internal audit department or audit firm. Experience in compliance audits and knowledge of compliance is a pro.
Communicative skills, able to explain compliance requirements to the business so that they can take their 1st line responsibility to manage the non-financial risk framework
Team player, good communication skills and able to work under time pressure
Has the soft skills to convey the message both verbally and in writing at all levels of the organization.
Hands-on mentality and service minded
Able to work independently. Drive to succeed and finalize tasks in time. Drive to deliver a high quality of work
Can take a stand as a representative of 2nd line function. But also has awareness that satisfying customer needs is our reason for existence
Be able to deal with multiple tasks at the same time
Preferably proficient in Dutch (verbal and written). Proficient in English (verbal and written).
Company profile:

BMG is an independent bank that is a 100% subsidiary of ING Bank. We have intensive co-operation with our ING colleagues. You will be part of an enthusiastic team with more than 200 colleagues. We are located in Amsterdam City Center.

We offer cash pooling and netting services to large (mostly listed) multinationals and their subsidiaries worldwide (‘treasury services for treasurers’). Our products enables our clients to optimize the use of their bank balances within their company. Numerous worldwide well-known brands are customer of BMG.
Our department:
You will work at the Operational Risk and Compliance department of BMG. The main tasks and responsibilities of this department are:
Monitoring and measuring the compliance, operational, IT and personal & physical security risks of BMG in a 2nd line role. Ensure that these are in conformity with the desired risk levels

Supporting the 1st line in meeting requirements resulting from ING’s non-financial risk framework (“NFR Framework”). Supporting them to find the optimal balance between managing non-financial risks and realizing operational, commercial and financial targets
Offering specialist knowledge and advice regarding non-financial risks to the BMG organization
Performing monitoring activities to verify proper functioning of processes and controls

Participating in various changes, for example related to implementation of new and updated ING policies and external requirements. But also, in changes regarding product, process or IT changes and improvements
Liaison for BMG with various other ING departments, the external auditor and supervisory authorities.
What we offer:

A job from 36 to 40 hours and a unique offer that fits in with the times of today. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.
To give you an idea, we will tell you about the benefits of working at ING:
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience

wholesale,Indeed,p_fbdfbc0ffc88c382,Auditor with Compliance knowledge or Compliance Officer with Audit background,ING, Amsterdam,"We are looking for a Compliance Officer / Auditor with a key focus on Compliance Quality Assurance and Reporting.

Bank Mendes Gans N.V. (BMG) is part of ING Wholesale Banking. We are looking for a colleague who has experience in a related function (e.g. Internal Audit, External Audit, Compliance Quality Assurance) and who has the right skills and personality to fulfill this role in a dynamic organization. You have knowledge of Compliance / Internal Audit or are able to obtain this within a short time frame. We offer an interesting and challenging job in a dedicated and enthusiastic team.
What you’ll do:
Executing review activities on Control Testing related to Compliance done by the 1st line departments (“Second Line Monitoring”)
Preparing and executing the yearly Quality Assurance plan for compliance according to the applicable ING Guidelines
Preparing and executing the Control Testing on the processes of which Compliance is the owner
Monitoring the execution and progress of the yearly “NFR” cycle” (e.g. Business Environment Assessments, Risk Assessments, Key Control Testing) from Compliance perspective
Contributing to meeting ING reporting requirements (e.g. monthly/quarterly risk reports, compliance sign-off’s, maintenance of all data in the ING risk application Irisk)
Contribute in preparing the monthly meetings of the Non-Financial Risk Committee and 2nd line contributions to Know Your Customer and Customer Integrity Risk Committees (KYC and CIRC)
Analysis of (compliance) events, using the outcome in improving the business and preventing reoccurrence
Participating in various projects in the field of non-financial risks from a 2nd line perspective
Liaising with other ING departments (WB Compliance, WB MLRO, Corporate Audit Services), Dutch Central Bank and external auditors when necessary. Liaising with other BMG 1st and 2nd line departments

Although your focus will primarily be on compliance, you must see where compliance links with other non-financial risk areas, such as operational, IT and Legal risks as in current world these risk types are more and more mingled
You handle your tasks in cooperation with your colleagues and with your experience you support your colleagues and enable to grow in their roles

It is also important that you help 1st line to assume their responsibilities regarding compliance and to become more mature. This means, among other things, knowledge transfer, improvement of processes and challenge where necessary.
How to succeed:
University degree (preferably Law or Economics) or equivalent (e.g. bachelor’s degree with proven academic thinking level)
Experience in the field of auditing (internal and/or external), either within an internal audit department or audit firm. Experience in compliance audits and knowledge of compliance is a pro.
Communicative skills, able to explain compliance requirements to the business so that they can take their 1st line responsibility to manage the non-financial risk framework
Team player, good communication skills and able to work under time pressure
Has the soft skills to convey the message both verbally and in writing at all levels of the organization.
Hands-on mentality and service minded
Able to work independently. Drive to succeed and finalize tasks in time. Drive to deliver a high quality of work
Can take a stand as a representative of 2nd line function. But also has awareness that satisfying customer needs is our reason for existence
Be able to deal with multiple tasks at the same time
Preferably proficient in Dutch (verbal and written). Proficient in English (verbal and written).
Company profile:

BMG is an independent bank that is a 100% subsidiary of ING Bank. We have intensive co-operation with our ING colleagues. You will be part of an enthusiastic team with more than 200 colleagues. We are located in Amsterdam City Center.

We offer cash pooling and netting services to large (mostly listed) multinationals and their subsidiaries worldwide (‘treasury services for treasurers’). Our products enables our clients to optimize the use of their bank balances within their company. Numerous worldwide well-known brands are customer of BMG.
Our department:
You will work at the Operational Risk and Compliance department of BMG. The main tasks and responsibilities of this department are:
Monitoring and measuring the compliance, operational, IT and personal & physical security risks of BMG in a 2nd line role. Ensure that these are in conformity with the desired risk levels

Supporting the 1st line in meeting requirements resulting from ING’s non-financial risk framework (“NFR Framework”). Supporting them to find the optimal balance between managing non-financial risks and realizing operational, commercial and financial targets
Offering specialist knowledge and advice regarding non-financial risks to the BMG organization
Performing monitoring activities to verify proper functioning of processes and controls

Participating in various changes, for example related to implementation of new and updated ING policies and external requirements. But also, in changes regarding product, process or IT changes and improvements
Liaison for BMG with various other ING departments, the external auditor and supervisory authorities.
What we offer:

A job from 36 to 40 hours and a unique offer that fits in with the times of today. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.
To give you an idea, we will tell you about the benefits of working at ING:
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work at home
Reimbursement for travel expenses
24 vacation days with a 36-hour working week. If you work 40 hours a week, you will receive 27 vacation days
Pension scheme
13th month salary
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
8% Holiday payment
Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities to realize your ambitions
An informal working environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the very best
Progressive way of working according to the Agile method, so that new ideas come to life
Questions?

Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=2a997915d5f28483&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=bce275941bb735af&assa=8688,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=fbdfbc0ffc88c382&fccid=1b136e87924de053&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-05

wholesale,Indeed,p_5447d5a2d3a142e4,Auditor with Compliance knowledge or Compliance Officer with Audit background,ING, Amsterdam,"We are looking for a Compliance Officer / Auditor with a key focus on Compliance Quality Assurance and Reporting.

Bank Mendes Gans N.V. (BMG) is part of ING Wholesale Banking. We are looking for a colleague who has experience in a related function (e.g. Internal Audit, External Audit, Compliance Quality Assurance) and who has the right skills and personality to fulfill this role in a dynamic organization. You have knowledge of Compliance / Internal Audit or are able to obtain this within a short time frame. We offer an interesting and challenging job in a dedicated and enthusiastic team.
What you’ll do:
Executing review activities on Control Testing related to Compliance done by the 1st line departments (“Second Line Monitoring”)
Preparing and executing the yearly Quality Assurance plan for compliance according to the applicable ING Guidelines
Preparing and executing the Control Testing on the processes of which Compliance is the owner
Monitoring the execution and progress of the yearly “NFR” cycle” (e.g. Business Environment Assessments, Risk Assessments, Key Control Testing) from Compliance perspective
Contributing to meeting ING reporting requirements (e.g. monthly/quarterly risk reports, compliance sign-off’s, maintenance of all data in the ING risk application Irisk)
Contribute in preparing the monthly meetings of the Non-Financial Risk Committee and 2nd line contributions to Know Your Customer and Customer Integrity Risk Committees (KYC and CIRC)
Analysis of (compliance) events, using the outcome in improving the business and preventing reoccurrence
Participating in various projects in the field of non-financial risks from a 2nd line perspective
Liaising with other ING departments (WB Compliance, WB MLRO, Corporate Audit Services), Dutch Central Bank and external auditors when necessary. Liaising with other BMG 1st and 2nd line departments

Although your focus will primarily be on compliance, you must see where compliance links with other non-financial risk areas, such as operational, IT and Legal risks as in current world these risk types are more and more mingled
You handle your tasks in cooperation with your colleagues and with your experience you support your colleagues and enable to grow in their roles

It is also important that you help 1st line to assume their responsibilities regarding compliance and to become more mature. This means, among other things, knowledge transfer, improvement of processes and challenge where necessary.
How to succeed:
University degree (preferably Law or Economics) or equivalent (e.g. bachelor’s degree with proven academic thinking level)
Experience in the field of auditing (internal and/or external), either within an internal audit department or audit firm. Experience in compliance audits and knowledge of compliance is a pro.
Communicative skills, able to explain compliance requirements to the business so that they can take their 1st line responsibility to manage the non-financial risk framework
Team player, good communication skills and able to work under time pressure
Has the soft skills to convey the message both verbally and in writing at all levels of the organization.
Hands-on mentality and service minded
Able to work independently. Drive to succeed and finalize tasks in time. Drive to deliver a high quality of work
Can take a stand as a representative of 2nd line function. But also has awareness that satisfying customer needs is our reason for existence
Be able to deal with multiple tasks at the same time
Preferably proficient in Dutch (verbal and written). Proficient in English (verbal and written).
Company profile:

BMG is an independent bank that is a 100% subsidiary of ING Bank. We have intensive co-operation with our ING colleagues. You will be part of an enthusiastic team with more than 200 colleagues. We are located in Amsterdam City Center.

We offer cash pooling and netting services to large (mostly listed) multinationals and their subsidiaries worldwide (‘treasury services for treasurers’). Our products enables our clients to optimize the use of their bank balances within their company. Numerous worldwide well-known brands are customer of BMG.
Our department:
You will work at the Operational Risk and Compliance department of BMG. The main tasks and responsibilities of this department are:
Monitoring and measuring the compliance, operational, IT and personal & physical security risks of BMG in a 2nd line role. Ensure that these are in conformity with the desired risk levels

Supporting the 1st line in meeting requirements resulting from ING’s non-financial risk framework (“NFR Framework”). Supporting them to find the optimal balance between managing non-financial risks and realizing operational, commercial and financial targets
Offering specialist knowledge and advice regarding non-financial risks to the BMG organization
Performing monitoring activities to verify proper functioning of processes and controls

Participating in various changes, for example related to implementation of new and updated ING policies and external requirements. But also, in changes regarding product, process or IT changes and improvements
Liaison for BMG with various other ING departments, the external auditor and supervisory authorities.
What we offer:

A job from 36 to 40 hours and a unique offer that fits in with the times of today. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.
To give you an idea, we will tell you about the benefits of working at ING:
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work at home
Reimbursement for travel expenses
24 vacation days with a 36-hour working week. If you work 40 hours a week, you will receive 27 vacation days
Pension scheme
13th month salary
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
8% Holiday payment
Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities to realize your ambitions
An informal working environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the very best
Progressive way of working according to the Agile method, so that new ideas come to life
Questions?

Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=2a997915d5f28483&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=bce275941bb735af&assa=8688,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=5447d5a2d3a142e4&fccid=47886706cecc031e&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-05

We are looking for a colleague who has experience in a related function (e.g. Internal Audit, External Audit, Compliance Quality Assurance) and who has the right skills and personality to fulfill this role in a dynamic organization. You have knowledge of Compliance / Internal Audit or are able to obtain this within a short time frame. We offer an interesting and challenging job in a dedicated and enthusiastic team.
What you’ll do:
Executing review activities on Control Testing related to Compliance done by the 1st line departments (“Second Line Monitoring”)
Preparing and executing the yearly Quality Assurance plan for compliance according to the applicable ING Guidelines
Preparing and executing the Control Testing on the processes of which Compliance is the owner
Monitoring the execution and progress of the yearly “NFR” cycle” (e.g. Business Environment Assessments, Risk Assessments, Key Control Testing) from Compliance perspective
Contributing to meeting ING reporting requirements (e.g. monthly/quarterly risk reports, compliance sign-off’s, maintenance of all data in the ING risk application Irisk)
Contribute in preparing the monthly meetings of the Non-Financial Risk Committee and 2nd line contributions to Know Your Customer and Customer Integrity Risk Committees (KYC and CIRC)
Analysis of (compliance) events, using the outcome in improving the business and preventing reoccurrence
Participating in various projects in the field of non-financial risks from a 2nd line perspective
Liaising with other ING departments (WB Compliance, WB MLRO, Corporate Audit Services), Dutch Central Bank and external auditors when necessary. Liaising with other BMG 1st and 2nd line departments

Although your focus will primarily be on compliance, you must see where compliance links with other non-financial risk areas, such as operational, IT and Legal risks as in current world these risk types are more and more mingled
You handle your tasks in cooperation with your colleagues and with your experience you support your colleagues and enable to grow in their roles

It is also important that you help 1st line to assume their responsibilities regarding compliance and to become more mature. This means, among other things, knowledge transfer, improvement of processes and challenge where necessary.
How to succeed:
University degree (preferably Law or Economics) or equivalent (e.g. bachelor’s degree with proven academic thinking level)
Experience in the field of auditing (internal and/or external), either within an internal audit department or audit firm. Experience in compliance audits and knowledge of compliance is a pro.
Communicative skills, able to explain compliance requirements to the business so that they can take their 1st line responsibility to manage the non-financial risk framework
Team player, good communication skills and able to work under time pressure
Has the soft skills to convey the message both verbally and in writing at all levels of the organization.
Hands-on mentality and service minded
Able to work independently. Drive to succeed and finalize tasks in time. Drive to deliver a high quality of work
Can take a stand as a representative of 2nd line function. But also has awareness that satisfying customer needs is our reason for existence
Be able to deal with multiple tasks at the same time
Preferably proficient in Dutch (verbal and written). Proficient in English (verbal and written).
Company profile:

BMG is an independent bank that is a 100% subsidiary of ING Bank. We have intensive co-operation with our ING colleagues. You will be part of an enthusiastic team with more than 200 colleagues. We are located in Amsterdam City Center.

We offer cash pooling and netting services to large (mostly listed) multinationals and their subsidiaries worldwide (‘treasury services for treasurers’). Our products enables our clients to optimize the use of their bank balances within their company. Numerous worldwide well-known brands are customer of BMG.
Our department:
You will work at the Operational Risk and Compliance department of BMG. The main tasks and responsibilities of this department are:
Monitoring and measuring the compliance, operational, IT and personal & physical security risks of BMG in a 2nd line role. Ensure that these are in conformity with the desired risk levels

Supporting the 1st line in meeting requirements resulting from ING’s non-financial risk framework (“NFR Framework”). Supporting them to find the optimal balance between managing non-financial risks and realizing operational, commercial and financial targets
Offering specialist knowledge and advice regarding non-financial risks to the BMG organization
Performing monitoring activities to verify proper functioning of processes and controls

Participating in various changes, for example related to implementation of new and updated ING policies and external requirements. But also, in changes regarding product, process or IT changes and improvements
Liaison for BMG with various other ING departments, the external auditor and supervisory authorities.
What we offer:

A job from 36 to 40 hours and a unique offer that fits in with the times of today. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.
To give you an idea, we will tell you about the benefits of working at ING:
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work at home
Reimbursement for travel expenses
24 vacation days with a 36-hour working week. If you work 40 hours a week, you will receive 27 vacation days
Pension scheme
13th month salary
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
8% Holiday payment
Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities to realize your ambitions
An informal working environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the very best
Progressive way of working according to the Agile method, so that new ideas come to life
Questions?

Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=2a997915d5f28483&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=bce275941bb735af&assa=8688,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=bc37333f5d054214&fccid=d5c3bb28ade61aba&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-05

column1: We are excited to share that due to a big client win in the Netherlands, we are looking for a Risk & Compliance Recruiter to join our RPO programme for ING in the Netherlands!
About ING

ING is a global bank with a strong European base. Our 57,000 employees serve around 39.3 million customers, corporate clients and financial institutions in over 40 countries. Our purpose is to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and in business.

Our products include savings, payments, investments, loans and mortgages in most of our retail markets. For our Wholesale Banking clients we provide specialised lending, tailored corporate finance, debt and equity market solutions, payments &amp
column2: cash management and trade and treasury services.

column1: You will be responsible for
Key stakeholder management and engagement
Managing the whole recruitment process from end to end
Recommending and agreeing suitable sourcing strategies with the hiring manager community
Driving a strong candidate pipeline by utilising all sourcing channels available such as engaging our own internal direct recruitment team, referrals and advertising
Ensuring compliance is adhered to throughout the recruitment end to end process
Effectively managing and utilising recruitment systems including some reporting
The successful candidate must have
proven RPO, agency or corporate recruitment experience
experience with recruiting risk & compliance profiles (banking industry experience is big advantage)
strong process management skills
extensive stakeholder management experience
excellent command of the Dutch and English language
In return you will receive
excellent benefits package including holidays which can be bought and sold and a competitive share scheme

opportunity to work with a world class recruitment business with leading technology, tools and innovation which allow our teams to focus on the human side of recruitment and provide a first class experience to both our clients and our candidates
extensive learning opportunities and a set career path
Please apply today to be part of our world class team!
In case you are interested in applying or if you have any questions, please turn to our internal TA Partner Matej Hoyt at:

excellent command of the Dutch and English language

wholesale,Indeed,p_bc37333f5d054214,Frontend Developer,ITSync, Amsterdam,"Front-end Developer

The organization is a European financial service provider specialized as an intermediary in the wholesale Financial and Renewable Energy sector. With over 100 employees from offices in 4 countries they provides voice and hybrid brokering, execution, electronic trading and transaction advice services for a wide range of asset classes.

For their Electronic Venues department, they are searching for a Junior/Medior Front-end developer. In this role you will be working on an innovative electronic platform which provide tradability for SME shares. As developer you will be part of an intelligent and highly motivated development team with 8 direct colleagues. Your main task will be to design, develop and implement the frontend of our state-of-the-art trading platform. This platform should meet the needs of fast-growing market segments and comply with all relevant regulatory requirements. The development will take place in close consultation with your direct IT colleagues, their Front office and, where necessary, relevant market parties.
Must have experience:
You have at least 1-year relevant working experience.
You communicate fluently in English and Dutch.
Projects using Vue.js or has experience using a similar modern Javascript framework.
HTML and CSS knowledge.
CSS pre processors.
Preferred:
Design/wireframing interest or experience.
Experience with Graphql.
Frontend Testing experience and opinions (End to end, unit testing).
It’s important you are conscientious, and you have a strong sense of agency.
Open in communication to tackle the project’s complexities together.
You show interest in the financial services industry.
Practical knowledge of Agile software development methodologies.
Offer:
One of the most interesting work environments in Amsterdam, the old trading floor of the historical Amsterdam Stock Exchange.
Working in an awesome, ambitious and driven high performing team.
Energetic and friendly colleagues from all over the world.
A versatile full-time position in a fast growing and professional organization with years of experience.
Competitive remuneration and training possibilities.
27 holidays per calendar year.
NS Business card (depending on your residence).
Free inhouse fitness.

A variety of activities with the team.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=bc37333f5d054214&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=18e151357ceb5da6&assa=4492,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=bc37333f5d054214&fccid=d5c3bb28ade61aba&vjs=3,4 dagen geleden,4 dagen geleden,2021-04-05

wholesale,Indeed,p_a2114fe06a566153,Azure Cloud Engineer | Worldwide Market Leader Flower Wholesale,Layer, Amsterdam,"Azure Cloud Engineer | IaaS Platform | Azure Platform Deployment on Windows and Linux | Worldwide Market Leader Flower Wholesale

I am searching for a passionate Azure Engineer with relevant Cloud Platform experience. This market leader of flower wholesale is an opportunity for international orientated Cloud Engineers with some scripting skills. Are you this Engineer?
Company

This company founded in the late 60’s is a global player in the market of Flower Wholesale. Founded by three brothers this company started exporting flowers to Germany. Through the 70’s and 80’s the company developed in a healthy way but not rapidly. End 90’s the company made a rapid expansion with some new investors and director at the wheel. The company expanded their operations to France and many other export markets were added to the portfolio. Now, in 2019 this company is the global market leader in Flower wholesale and products are delivered to 17 different countries every day. The company has a leading E-commerce platform for the complete supply chain and also a brand new app and web shop, this enables customers to order flowers anywhere anytime. Because of the big market their in and high volumes that go through the system a stable IT environment is priority, now for the growth of the Azure Platform team this company is looking for a Azure Cloud Engineer that helps the team to deploy, configure and maintain services in the Azure Cloud.
Position

As a Cloud Engineer you will strengthen the team above and you will be helping to deploy, configure and maintain services in the Azure Cloud. As much as possible you will script and automate tasks to deliver Infrastructure as a Code. On a daily bases you will troubleshoot Azure related issues, engage with SCRUM teams and talk to partners and suppliers. This happens in an Agile working environment. Last but not least you’re developing and documentate new processes and guidelines that will be used to keep the Cloud environment safe and sound.
Must haves
Minimal 3 years of Azure Cloud experience
Knowledge of IaaS
Scripting skills
Experience with PaaS operations
Certifications in Azure are preferable
Working conditions
Salary fitting your knowledge and experience
VISA Sponsorship is possible
Working on a challenge that is globally watched
Safe workplace
Good colleague cohesion
Travel expense
Holiday pay
Training budget
Are you interested in this position? Please contact Bart van Hattum

wholesale,Indeed,p_047abc5bc3e87d41,Medior Model Validator – IRRBB & ALM models,ING, Amsterdam,"Model Validation is looking for an enthusiastic, curious Medior Model Validator who likes to develop him/herself in the IRRBB validation chapter

ING’s global Model Validation IRRBB (“Interest Rate Risk in the Banking Book”) chapter is an energetic, diverse and collaborative international team consisting of about 15 highly qualified professionals of various quantitative backgrounds, located in Amsterdam.

Following ING’s Think Forward Strategy to become the next generation digital bank, data and models are considered key assets in our bank. As model validators we safeguard the quality of ING’s models, which are used for all kinds of decision making purposes. We also contribute to the Model Risk Management (r)evolution that is picking up worldwide, given that models are imperfect representations of reality and hence may lead to financial losses and/or reputational damage. To effectively achieve these challenges, our Model Validation teams have been substantially growing in size lately and will further grow, also internationally.

We are responsible for validating IRRBB & ALM (“Asset & Liability Management”) models used by ING in about 40 countries all over the globe. We cover an interesting, wide and evolving model scope aimed to measure the impact of IRRBB on expected earnings and economic value as well as various ALM models used in balance sheet management. These models vary from those having a technically advanced quantitative orientation to those displaying strong expert judgment (in case of e.g. limited data availability). Our core business consists of independently assessing whether a particular model is fit for the purpose it was designed for, based on the business context, academic theories, empirical evidence, regulations, best practices & technological innovations. Effective challenge is key in our role. Herewith we contribute to sound business practices, supporting a healthy, sustainable ING and global financial stability.
The role of model validator

As a model validator you focus on and further learn about the topics related to the models in your scope, using econometrics, quantitative finance, coding, business knowledge and related regulations. You perform in-depth analyses and write code to perform quantitative assessments. You summarize your analyses and conclusions in clear, fact-based and persuasively written reports, which are presented to the relevant Model Approval Committee. You share your knowledge and effectively communicate with team members and a wide range of internal and external stakeholders. You also have the opportunity to participate in the development of innovative, state-of the-art validation frameworks and coding libraries.
Your main daily activities consist of the following:

Assessing the fundamental assumptions underlying the models in scope, whether the models are correctly implemented in the systems, and their appropriateness given the business and (evolving) regulatory context.

Writing high quality validation reports, to be discussed with e.g. model developers, senior management, auditors, the ECB and other regulators. These reports include a description of the methodology, your model risk assessment of the various model validation dimensions, as well as a number of findings for model improvement (which require follow-up by the developers).
Preparing ad-hoc analyses for e.g. senior management and providing advice on model risk.

Participating in the expansion and promotion of our new validation frameworks. These include policies, validation minimum standards and working instructions that aim to professionalize the model risk assessment based on the key model validation dimensions.
Participating in the development of our new validation coding libraries.
Your prospective model scope is broad and are related to the following main areas:
Behavioral: Modelling of mortgage & other loan prepayments and non-maturity deposits, as well as other embedded options in retail and wholesale products.
Interest rate: Market models (e.g. Hull-White model).
Valuation: Models used for calculating the economic value of a loan or deposit portfolio with embedded options.
Pricing: Models used for product pricing.
Replication: Models used for risk transfer.
Risk measurement: Models used for risk management and reporting (NPVaR, RRaR, NIIaR).
As part of the IRRBB chapter, you will contribute to further building and developing the team by sharing knowledge, coaching more junior staff and by embracing ING’s Agile way of working.
Who are we looking for

We are looking for enthusiastic colleagues who enjoy performing quantitative analyses, writing & defending high quality validation reports, and have an intrinsic curiosity to continuously expand their knowledge. In particular, as a member of our team, you have:

A quantitative background, i.e. a MSc or PhD degree in e.g. (Financial) Econometrics, Financial Mathematics, Quantitative Financial Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics etc. with a minimum of 4-5 years of relevant experience.
Depending on seniority level, a curiosity about/are proficient in IRRBB/ALM modelling.
Solid programming experience (preferably in Python and/or R).

Strong verbal communication skills. You enjoy sharing and presenting your work to colleagues, senior management, auditors, the ECB and other regulators, and are able to defend your stand point in plain language.
Good English writing skills, you are accurate and skilled at drafting reports.

Above all, you have a genuine passion to continuously improve yourself and our team. As a model validator at ING, you will be empowered to have a true impact on ING’s future model landscape. Moreover, you will contribute to further implementing ING’s innovative Think Forward strategy.
Your work environment

The IRRBB Model Validation chapter is part of ING’s global Model Risk Management domain, which consists of multiple Model Validation teams (i.e. “chapters”, each focusing on a main risk area(s)) and Model Risk Oversight, located both in Amsterdam and Poland.
The domain has adopted and will further progress with the ING One Way of Working. In our organisational set-up, we distinguish tribes, chapters and squads.

Our main stakeholders are within ING’s head office and local risk management departments worldwide, senior management (including the CRO, his management team, the Executive Board and local CROs), internal and external auditors, the ECB and other regulators. To ensure its independence and effective challenge, Model Risk Management reports directly to the CRO.

Our work environment can be described as dynamic and professional, with changing requirements and needs. We work in a spirit of trust, a sense of purpose, curiosity, cooperation and open communications. Continuous learning, adding value to our stakeholders and building on differences are important. We empower our people to take responsibility and promote continuous improvements, innovation and automation.
What we offer
At ING we offer you a 40 (or 36) hour contract. We care about an adequate work–life balance and we empower our colleagues to realize their ambitions: “Do your thing.”
Our employment conditions are specified here. In particular, we offer:
A flexible work environment, with the possibility of working from home.
Time and support for personal development, including courses.
A challenging, interesting and evolving job/career.
An informal and positive working environment with highly qualified colleagues, who like to improve, value diversity and support each other.
An innovative, expanding working environment, also internationally, creating ample opportunities for further development.
A progressive way of working according to the Agile method, so that new ideas come to life incrementally.
A competitive salary tailored to your skills, competences, experience and performance.
A choice in transportation allowances.
27 vacation days with a 40-hour contract (or 24 based on 36h), as well 1.5 days of “diversity days”.
A good pension scheme.
A 13th-month salary.
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS) (i.e., 3.5% of your gross annual salary.
8% Holiday payment.
Interested to learn more?
Apply directly online by clicking on “Apply for this job”.
Watch and read why your potential future colleagues love modelling at ING by clicking below links:
https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Expertise/Risk-Management.htm

At adidas we're redefining our digital presence in a way that will push the future of Digital and create premium experiences across all our consumer touchpoints to drive brand desirability, engagement and sales for our adidas and Reebok brands. The Digital Partner Commerce team is driving this evolution: join us and help us shape this transformation.

As part of the Digital Partner Commerce team you'll be part of a Global team. We are a dynamic, collaborative, and diverse team with a passion for both our partners (our top wholesale accounts) and our Brand. You will work in an agile, fast-paced organization, which works closely with our teams in the Markets, and is tasked with accelerating the experience and the sales of our products online through our partners (retail accounts such as Footlocker, JD Sports) or Pure Players (like Zalando, ASOS).

You will be a member of the Digital Business Development function, that is responsible for the outlook of our digital selling ecosystem, defining where growth will come from, and (new) business models. Within this team your area of focus will be the Partner Program business model, a business that allows us to connect consumer demand in our Partners' sites (e.g. Zalando, Nordstrom, NetShoes) to product that sits in our supply chain. Partner program is one of our most effective tools to grow our business with partners profitably and sustainably, but also allows us to continue to improve the consumer experience outside of our owned ecosystem (adidas.com and adidas retail stores).
Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organization:

As a Senior Manager Partner Program in adidas Digital Partner Commerce (DPC) you are accountable for development of the Partner Program business globally. Partner Program plays a key growth role within the 2025 Strategic Plan. Your key task is to turn the 2025 Partner Program Strategy into actionable reality through orchestrating the delivery of the end-to-end adidas landscape. This includes coordinating alignment across the global and market stakeholder network and facilitating a wider transformation of our wholesale business towards a more digital culture and mindset. This role will have exposure to C-level stakeholders and require strong stakeholder management, influencing and convincing at both global and market levels.
Key Responsibilities:
Drive the realization of the Partner Program strategy by leading major strategic initiatives with responsibility for growing the business, assessing opportunities, and prioritizing roadmaps.
Evaluate new business models or opportunities, give input into strategic direction, selection criteria etc.
Oversee cross-functional initiatives towards business goals. Drive for results and monitor progress in achieving goals.
You will own the playbook for digital commercial business models to ensure consistency and harmonization at market level
Enable strategy execution by developing and spearheading key change initiatives.

Support business development activities such as identification and prioritization of opportunities. For assigned topics, lead from concept development and implementation until handover to business for steady state operations.

Monitor the performance of strategic initiatives within your scope of responsibility. Identify deviations from targets and drive necessary changes to ensure achievement of those targets. Monitor and evaluate changes implemented.
Evolve existing frameworks and operational processes based on learnings during implementation to ensure digital growth and efficiency.
You will have oversight of what is required to achieve business or roll out plans, the sharing of best practice across markets and accounts
Manage change activities and ad-hoc transformation projects to guarantee the alignment of organization culture and strategy.
Provide formal, continuous communication with leadership stakeholders and the wider community on success metrics.
Develop key strategy updates for internal and external audiences, tailoring content and messaging by audience.
Key Relationships:
Market & Global Digital Partner Commerce teams
Partner Program Market leads and teams
Digital Sales Solutions
Global / Local Analytics
Global Sales Development
Global Wholesale teams
Supply Chain Management, IT, Finance, and Legal teams
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
A passion and curiosity for the digital business: You see digital as a sales channel, enabler and strategic weapon
Insights to action: Passionate about deriving business insight from data, improving business processes and performance
Results-oriented: You have a bias for action. When problems arise, you reliably produce responses, thoughtful solutions and then role up your sleeves to implement.
Excellent problem-solving skills: Ability to present and map complex business solutions and processes (interest business eCommerce a must)
Solutions-oriented approach and entrepreneurial mindset
Good numerical and analytical skills
Strong organizational and planning skills to handle multiple tasks and business partners
Good communicator and collaborator: You work effectively with all members of the organization, from individual contributors to top execs.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with different international cultures
Ability to handle ambiguity and untangle complex situations into actionable activities
Fluency in English is required
column2: at least one other European language would be beneficial.

column1: Basic leadership skills are required
Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:
BA / BS in Business, Marketing, Finance, Economics or related field (MBA preferred)
6+ years professional experience (demonstrated experience in business development, platform management or sales is a key requirement)
Passion for digital, with eCommerce experience

adidas Careers | A World Full of Possibilities video",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=9967c1fd53a558ae&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=1ea3aae2f349d6f5&assa=6499,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=e811ded5ebcce4b9&fccid=f8b265243da9f9d7&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-06

wholesale,Indeed,p_2a9bac7e2ab348a4,Software Architect – Financial Markets,ING, Amsterdam,"ING is looking for a Software Architect with technical skills & experience on expert level. You are technically passionate, able to work with squads based in multiple countries and able to safeguard and improve the architectural integrity of the Competitive Services applications. The ING Competitive Services area within the Financial Market Tribe is offering financial solutions such as:
Cash & Liquidity Management applications – Solution for managing ING’s global liquidity obligations
column2: Cash and liquidity forecasting, and In- & External regulatory requirements including financial risk reporting

column1: Market Data Management application – Solution for sending market data to financial market applications
Document Management application – Solution for managing, archiving, distribution and reporting on Financial Markets related documents
Transaction Reporting applications – Solution for reporting all types of transactions to external regulators
Trade & Communication Surveillance – Solutions for monitoring and detecting market manipulation within Wholesale Banking
These solutions are supported by 8 agile/scrum squads cooperating towards one Financial Markets IT landscape from 3 locations, Amsterdam, Bucharest and Bangalore.
What you’ll do
As a Software Architect
you will be based in Amsterdam and will be working together with your colleagues in Amsterdam, Bucharest and India
you will work with the squads on design challenges and support them to integrate the solution in the overall landscape
you will be hosting a – to be setup - Technical Design Board / Architecture guild within the Competitive Services area
you will be discussing with your stakeholders and product owner about features and stories and can translate these into software with real business value.
How to succeed/What you bring to the team
University degree in Computer Science, Cybernetics, Software Engineering, Financial Engineering or equivalent
8+ years of software engineering and development experience including design and automation
Strong analytical skills, proactivity and ability to work in cross-border international teams
Knowledge of (Data) Architecture Design and Integration Patterns
Desire to work with different technology stacks in order to achieve the best solution for a given problem and to understand the impact of a design decision

Hands-on experience with different technologies, such as programming languages (e.g. Java, Python, C#, Scripting languages), middleware messaging systems (e.g. Kafka, Tibco BW, MQ, Camel), databases (SQL and NoSQL) and platforms (Cloud, Linux, Windows)
You have a good understanding of banking in general and about financial market specifically or you are passionate about learning it.
You are agnostic to the technology platform
Experience or affinity with IT Security concepts (Secure By Design)
Good communication skills in English
Your benefits

A job offer that fits in with the times of today. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.
To give you an idea, we will tell you about the benefits of working at ING:
A job from 36 to 40 hours that fits your schedule to balance work and private life
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
24 vacation days with 36-hour work week. (or 27 days with 40)
Pension scheme
13th month salary
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
8% Holiday payment
Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster
Questions?
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.
About us

With around 52,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to make a diﬀerence. We hire smart people like you for your potential, not your past. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on more responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.

If you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible, surrounded by progressive, inspiring and supportive colleagues, there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=2a9bac7e2ab348a4&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=2664d52f1dce162c&assa=2401,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=2a9bac7e2ab348a4&fccid=5b16841c3468a10d&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-09

wholesale,Indeed,pj_5a6e37c67a8d8ef0,Logistics Wholesale Partner Coordinator,Hunkemller, Hilversum,"In this role, you will independently carry out operational work together with your colleagues. You are in contact with external parties such as: Logistic Service Providers, Wholesale/Concession partners and transporters. You will also be in contact with internal parties such as: the Distribution Centre, Financial Administration, Import / Export, Merchandise, Purchasing and E-commerce.
Join our journey to be a loved, social & inclusive brand and contribute to our success by performing these tasks:
Main area 1:
Managing and processing orders from Wholesale (including Zalando, ASOS, BOL) and Concession partners (including Wehkamp, Amazon).
Registering and preparing deliveries to Ecom partners
Taking care of recalls from the Ecom partners
Handling logistical complaints such as defects, delivery, late delivery, damage etc. from or by shops/Ecom partners or carriers
Over time, replenishment data from night processing for the production process in the DC will also be processed
Main area 2:
If necessary, support other department-oriented activities such as container planning, etc.
Customer-oriented and effective communication with internal and external customers
Contributes to the optimization of the (administrative) processes
Planning work and coordinating colleagues within set frameworks, setting priorities and monitoring progress
The ideal candidate has:
At least a MBO study
Knowledge of SAP or similar system and MS Office
Good knowledge of the English language and Dutch
At least 2 years of work experience in a similar position
High degree of accuracy
Customer-oriented thinking and working
Logistical experience is an advantage

Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2021, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.

Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!
Apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile only.
For this role, we're not looking to work with external agencies.
